719792f-a.text:
Port Tryon Park: A set of 3 views,photographed in the Park,of various features. No. 1 is northwards across the North (Hudson) River; No. 2 in the Park, while No. 3 is from Riverside Drive.
June 22, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719792f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park.

June 22, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719793f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park.

719794f-a.text:
Fort Tryon Park: A set of 2 views northwestward toward the
Palisades of New Jersey from the Park.
July 30, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719794f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park.

Lee, New Jersey from the park heights.
July 30, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719795f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park.

719796f-a.folder: Fort Tryon Park & [196th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY
719796f-a.text:
Fort Tryon Park: A southward view from a point in same on a line with West 196th Street and showing the southern half of this Park. The roadway on the left is Park lDrive, a continuation of Fort Washington Ave., towards which the photographer is viewing and upon both sides of which appear buildings. The George Washington Bridge appears partially
on the extreme right.
June 22, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719796f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park - [196th Street (West).]

719797f-a.text:
Fort Tryon Park: A set of 2 views showing the recently completed Cloisters; a medieval art treasure house of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The photographer is viewing northward and shows the southern side of same.
September 11, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
719797f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park.

719797f-b.text:

719799f-a.text:
Fort Tryon Park: The Cloisters, a new museum recently completed and which will house the medieval art treasures of the Metropolitan
Museum of Art.
June 1938
George D. Chinn
719799f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park.

719809f-a.text:
Fort Tryon Park: Three similar views photographed near the new Museum Building. Across the Hudson River appears Fort Lee, nestling at the foot of the Palisades. The Ferry boat shown in one of these views is progressing toward that point after leaving Dyckman Street.
June 22, 1936.
Views 2 & 3: - July 30, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
719809f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park - [Museum.]

P. L. Sperr.
719809f-b.title: Manhattan: Fort Tryon Park - [Museum.]
